decks.notes: The main concept of this UWx Control deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal spells, and card draw, while eventually winning with powerful finishers such as Entreat the Angels or Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Force of Will and Counterbalance, while setting up its own draws with Brainstorm, Ponder, and Accumulated Knowledge. By efficiently managing resources and answering threats, this deck looks to outvalue the opponent and secure victory in the late game.

The main focus of this Grixis Aggro deck is to quickly establish board presence and apply pressure on the opponent through efficiently utilizing cheap spells and disruptive elements like hand disruption and counterspells. By efficiently using cards like Young Pyromancer and Delver of Secrets, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent, while also having access to powerful threats like True-Name Nemesis and Gurmag Angler to close out games. The mana denial strategy, through cards like Wasteland, further adds to the disruption game plan, making it difficult for the opponent to stabilize or execute their game plan effectively.

The main focus of this Grixis Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through a combination of hand disruption, removal spells, and countermagic, while also generating card advantage through efficient card draw and value creatures like Baleful Strix and Snapcaster Mage. The deck aims to control the game by maintaining board presence and limiting the opponent's resources, ultimately leading to a win condition with powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor. This deck excels at adapting to different matchups and outmaneuvering opponents through careful resource management and strategic decision-making.

The main concept of this UWx Control deck is to utilize a combination of counterspells, card draw, and removal to control the game and outvalue the opponent. By playing powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Jace, the Mind Sculptor, along with efficient creatures like Snapcaster Mage and Monastery Mentor, the deck aims to maintain tempo and card advantage while disrupting the opponent's game plan. Cards like Counterbalance and Back to Basics help further control the board, while cards like Swords to Plowshares and Council's Judgment provide versatile removal options.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through countermagic, removal spells, and board wipes, while also controlling card advantage and manipulating the top of the deck with cards like Predict and Counterbalance. By using powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and versatile creatures like Snapcaster Mage, the deck can generate incremental advantages over time and out-value the opponent. The mana base is optimized for consistency and can support the deck's multiple color requirements. Ultimately, the deck aims to control the game and win through attrition and resource management.

The main concept of this UWx Control deck is to control the board through a combination of removal spells like Swords to Plowshares, Counterspells like Force of Will and Counterbalance, and board wipes like Terminus and Supreme Verdict. The deck also relies on card advantage with cards like Brainstorm, Accumulated Knowledge, and Snapcaster Mage. The win condition of the deck is to gradually grind out opponents with threats like Monastery Mentor and Jace, the Mind Sculptor, while protecting them with counter magic and removal spells.

This deck focuses on using Life from the Loam to continually recur lands and control the game through mana denial with cards like Wasteland and Ghost Quarter. It utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Gaddock Teeg to disrupt opponent's strategies, while also utilizing versatile removal options like Abrupt Decay and Punishing Fire. The deck also includes efficient threats like Knight of the Reliquary and Dark Confidant to pressure opponents. The main goal is to grind out advantages through efficient resource management and control the pace of the game.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana using Cloudpost and Glimmerpost, enabling powerful plays with Primeval Titan and Show and Tell to cheat out massive Eldrazi creatures like Ulamog and Emrakul. The deck also includes control elements like Pithing Needle and Abrupt Decay to disrupt opponents while digging for key pieces with card draw and search effects like Brainstorm, Ponder, Expedition Map, and Crop Rotation. The strategy revolves around quickly overwhelming opponents with enormous threats and shutting down their key strategies.

This Eldrazi Aggro deck focuses on utilizing powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Thought-Knot Seer and Oblivion Sower to quickly overwhelm opponents. The deck also includes cards like Chalice of the Void and Walking Ballista to disrupt opponent's strategies and control the board. With ramp cards like Ancient Tomb and Thran Dynamo, the deck can quickly cast its high-cost Eldrazi threats like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. The mana base is built around lands like Eldrazi Temple and Cloudpost to ensure consistent casting of Eldrazi creatures.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck in Legacy format is to ramp up mana quickly using lands like Glimmerpost, Eldrazi Temple, and Cloudpost, along with mana producers like Grim Monolith and Thran Dynamo. This allows you to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Thought-Knot Seer and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger early in the game. Additionally, cards like Chalice of the Void and Sorcerous Spyglass help disrupt your opponent's strategy while cards like Walking Ballista and Endbringer provide additional aggression and control options. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with fast, powerful creatures and efficient mana ramp.

The main concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to control the board early with disruptive spells like Thoughtseize, Daze, and Force of Will, while also applying pressure with efficient threats like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and True-Name Nemesis. The deck aims to be proactive and aggressive, utilizing burn spells like Lightning Bolt and creatures like Gurmag Angler to close out the game quickly. Additionally, the deck utilizes cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder to ensure consistent draws and keep the pressure on the opponent.

The main concept of this Infect combo deck is to quickly pump up and protect a creature with infect, like Blighted Agent or Glistener Elf, to deal 10 poison counters to the opponent. The deck utilizes card draw and counterspells to protect its creatures, as well as pump spells like Invigorate and Berserk to deal lethal damage in one swing. The deck also has mana ramp cards like Noble Hierarch and Crop Rotation to help generate the necessary resources to execute the combo efficiently.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and aggressively control the board by using efficient removal spells and countermagic while deploying threats that can close out the game quickly. By utilizing cards like Delver of Secrets, Nimble Mongoose, and True-Name Nemesis, the deck aims to pressure opponents while disrupting their game plan with cards like Stifle, Force of Will, and Daze. The mana base is streamlined to allow for consistent casting of spells, and the deck is designed to be able to adapt to various matchups in the Legacy format.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy using Human creatures. By utilizing cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Meddling Mage to disrupt the opponent's game plan, as well as Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play, the deck aims to establish a strong board presence quickly. The various lands such as Karakas, Unclaimed Territory, and Cavern of Souls support the deck's Human tribal theme and help to ensure efficient mana production. The goal is to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent before they can respond effectively.

The main idea of this Grixis Control deck is to establish control over the game through a combination of powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and removal spells like Diabolic Edict and Fatal Push. The deck also utilizes card advantage through cards like Baleful Strix and Snapcaster Mage, as well as disruption with cards like Hymn to Tourach and Thoughtseize. Additionally, it has a flexible removal package with cards like Kolaghan's Command and Lightning Bolt. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and enable consistent casting of spells.

The main concept of this deck is to generate a large amount of mana quickly through cards like Dark Ritual and Lion's Eye Diamond, then use that mana to cast multiple spells in a single turn in order to generate a storm count. Once a high storm count is achieved, the player can either win the game with Tendrils of Agony or refill their hand with Ad Nauseam. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Duress and Thoughtseize to control the opponent's hand and protect its own combo.
